function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"SARS-CoV-2 stability enhanced by bovine serum albumin, increasing potential for fomite transmission in indoor environments.","Impact":"Prolonged fomite transmission can lead to increased risk of infection in indoor settings.","Mitigation":"Regular cleaning and disinfection of indoor surfaces can reduce the risk of fomite transmission.","Technologies":"Effective disinfectants and cleaning equipment can be used to eliminate the virus on surfaces.","People":"Occupants of indoor environments, especially those with close contact with surfaces.","Owner":"Facility managers, cleaning staff, and occupants can implement regular cleaning and disinfection measures."},{"Description":"SARS-CoV-2 can remain infectious on surfaces for 1-7 days, potentially leading to surface-based transmission.","Impact":"Prolonged viability of SARS-CoV-2 on surfaces increases the risk of transmission through contact with contaminated surfaces.","Mitigation":"Frequent cleaning and disinfection of frequently touched surfaces can reduce the risk of surface-based transmission.","Technologies":"Use of proper disinfectants and cleaning protocols to eliminate the virus on surfaces.","People":"Individuals coming into contact with indoor surfaces, especially in shared spaces.","Owner":"Facility managers, cleaning staff, and individuals using the shared spaces can implement proper cleaning and disinfection measures."},{"Description":"Potential aerosol transmission of SARS-CoV-2 in specific medical procedures, increasing the risk of airborne infection.","Impact":"Increased risk of airborne transmission in healthcare settings and specific medical procedures.","Mitigation":"Strict adherence to infection control measures, including proper ventilation and use of personal protective equipment, can lower the risk of aerosol transmission.","Technologies":"High-efficiency particulate air (HEPA) filters and proper ventilation systems can help mitigate the risk of aerosol transmission.","People":"Healthcare workers, patients undergoing specific medical procedures.","Owner":"Healthcare facilities and medical personnel are responsible for implementing proper infection control measures."}]}
